title: Ullock Pike Walking Route

images.title: Philip Halling / Summit cairn, Ullock Pike
images.caption: Summit cairn. View to the north-west from the summit cairn of Ullock Pike. Bassenthwaite Lake can be seen in the valley below, with Sale Fell rising above Wythop Wood on the western slopes of the lake.

images.title: Philip Halling / The Edge, Ullock Pike
images.caption: The Edge. View to the north along The Edge below the summit of Ullock Pike, Binsey, the lakeland outlier can be seen in the background.

images.title: michael ely / Summit Cairn Ullock Pike
images.caption: At 690 metres above sea level, this is the first peak when climbing Skiddaw by way of Longside Edge from High Side. The lake left of shot is Derwent Water.

images.title: Toby Speight / Longside Edge
images.caption: Walkers on Longside Edge. An airy ridge with views down to Dodd; Keswick and Derwent Water beyond.

images.title: Philip Halling / Dodd viewed from Longside Edge
images.caption: Dodd viewed from Longside Edge. For many years this fell has be cloaked in trees, however, they have now been felled, thus providing those who climb its slopes with excellent views.

images.title: Philip Halling / Summit cairn, Carl Side
images.caption: View towards Longside from the summit cairn on Carl Side.

images.title: Michael Graham / In Dodd Wood
images.caption: In Dodd Wood. Forest road approaching the Car Park by Skill Beck

description: This circular walk climbs to Ullock Pike for some fine views over Bassenthwaite Lake. Start the walk from the Dodd Wood car park on the south eastern side of the lake. From here you can pick up woodland trails heading north east towards the Ravenstone Hotel. Here you pick up the Allerdale Ramble and follow the waymarked trail south towards Ullock Pike. At the 690 metre summit you will find a cairn and fine views to Bassenthwaite Lake, Derwent Water and many of the surrounding fells. The trail then heads south east along Longside Edge to Carl Side where there is a small tarn. This is a fine ridge walk with excellent views in all directions. At Carl Side the route turns south west to lead you back down to Dodd Wood where a final woodland section takes you back to the car park.
